headline.main: LEARNING TO SAY NO: SCHOOLS AND THE DRUG WAR - A SPECIAL REPORT: Judgment Replaces Fear in Drug Lessons

byline.original: By JOSEPH BERGER, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Once confined to a class session or two reciting horror stories and statistics, drug education in America is undergoing radical changes as the crack epidemic touches the lives of younger children across the country.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Once confined to a class session or two reciting horror stories and statistics, drug education in America is undergoing radical changes as the crack epidemic touches the lives of younger children across the country.

headline.main: On Not Going Up in Smoke

byline.original: By GLENN COLLINS; GLENN COLLINS reports on culture for The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: WHAT are hard-core tobacco addicts going to do now that a Congressional committee has agreed to ban smoking on domestic airline flights?
docs.snippet: LEAD: WHAT are hard-core tobacco addicts going to do now that a Congressional committee has agreed to ban smoking on domestic airline flights?
